MetaMeta,, as close partner of RAIN within the 3R consortium, was asked to - support the RHCC to write up the multi annual activity plan within the Dutch WASH Alliance program (2013-2015) and to develop a multi year strategy (beyond the Dutch WASH Alliance program). - support Helvetas SI in developing and operationalising the 3R WUMP modules.

RAIN has been working in Nepal since 2004 on rain water harvesting implementation through different partners. Since 2006, a ‘rainwater harvesting capacity centre’ (RHCC) was established. The RHCC is hosted by BSP – Nepal. After 7 years of collaboration between RAIN and the RHCC, a new multi-year strategy and activity plan are needed for the RHCC. Metameta will provide guidance in the process of developing those.
3R being one of the main pillars of RAINs strategy for the upcoming years, first steps have been made in 2011 and 2012 to introduce the catchment approach and 3R methodology to Nepal. Several partners are taking up the 3R approach in their upcoming RAIN supported implementation projects and Helvetas SI Nepal has been engaged to develop a 3R-module to incorporate it within its own water planning tool (WUMP).Metameta will provide support to ensure the 3R thinking is well reflected and taken up in the WUMP.
